intro: Meibomia cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Meibomia cuneata is often found in regions with high humidity and well-drained soil.
